definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
to deal a single fatal blow/(fig.) to totally repudiate sb because of a minor error
to bludgeon/to hit with a big stick

sentences.english: Tell the boy not to swish the flower heads off with his stick.
sentences.chinese: 告訴那小男孩別用棍子把花朵抽下來。

sentences.english: A long stick should be knocked into the earth.
sentences.chinese: 一根長棍子應該被敲進土裏。

sentences.english: Bows, arrows, and sticks with sharp iron points were their only weapons.
sentences.chinese: 他們的武器只有弓箭和帶有鐵尖的棍子。

sentences.english: Make up your mind, you’ll never use crutches or a stick, then have a go at everything.
sentences.chinese: 下定決心之後，你就永遠不會需要拐杖或者棍子。

sentences.english: The old man laid the robber out with a stick.
sentences.chinese: 老人用一根棍子將強盜打昏在地。

sentences.english: The pointed end of the stick pierced through its throat into its mouth.
sentences.chinese: 棍子的尖頭從它的喉嚨刺進它的嘴裏。

sentences.english: Place smaller sticks crosswise to make a lattice effect.
sentences.chinese: 把小一點的棍子交叉，做成格子陣的效果。

sentences.english: A stick is quickly found to beat a dog with.
sentences.chinese: 要打狗時會很快的發現一根棍子。

sentences.english: Males prefer to use the sticks to whack each other.
sentences.chinese: 雄性小猩猩則喜歡用棍子互相敲打。

sentences.english: Alternatively, suppose you had in front of you a stick.
sentences.chinese: 再想想，如果有一根棍子在你面前。

sentences.english: Stop those boys poking their sticks at the poor dog!
sentences.chinese: 別讓那幫孩子再用棍子戳那條可憐的狗了。

sentences.english: As the old saying goes, "Spare the stick, spoil the child."
sentences.chinese: 常言道，“省下了棍子，慣壞了孩子”。

sentences.english: He touched the ceiling with a stick.
He can fetch a stick, shake a paw, and play dead.
sentences.chinese: 他能拿棍子，揮舞它的爪子，和裝死。

sentences.english: It would be unfair, of course, to see all Chinese companies in this light.
sentences.chinese: 當然，一棍子打死所有中國企業的做法有失公平。

sentences.english: A pipe gives a wise man time to think and a fool something to stick in.
sentences.chinese: 煙管給聰明人靈感，給笨蛋口裏一個棍子。

definition: to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
wooden club (used to beat clothes in washing)
pitchfork/garden fork/restraining pole (used by police)/military fork (of ancient times)
